title: Install ICTML
text:
The ICTML software suite is available via R. It is implemented in R, Python, C, and C++. It can be installed as:
install.packages("ictml", repos = c("https://ictml-project.r-universe.dev",
                                    "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

title: About
text: Gilmer Valdes: With a background in medical physics, fellowship, and residency in Therapeutic Medical Physics, I specialize in machine learning for personalized treatment predictions, focusing on prostate and thoracic cancers. My recent work emphasizes enhancing model interpretability through methods like MediBoost, Additive Tree, and Representational Gradient Boosting. As Vice Chair of Machine Learning and Director of Clinical AI at Moffitt Cancer Center, I lead clinical AI adoption and collaborative ICTML projects. I also develop R and Python packages for cancer analysis (EAML, LINAD, Lockout) and previously directed UCSF’s “Advanced Machine Learning” course. Awarded an NIH BIBK08, my experience in algorithm development, education, and clinical AI application equips me to advance ICTML’s tools for cancer research.
